segment.source: Group Policy suggestions for compatibility with Internet Explorer 11
segment.target: Group Policy suggestions for compatibility with Internet Explorer 11

segment.source: Group Policy and compatibility with Internet Explorer 11 (Internet Explorer 11 for IT Pros)
segment.target: Group Policy and compatibility with Internet Explorer 11 (Internet Explorer 11 for IT Pros)

segment.source: Group Policy and compatibility with Internet Explorer 11
segment.target: Group Policy and compatibility with Internet Explorer 11

segment.source: Internet Explorer 11 has many Group Policy entries that can be configured for keeping your environment managed and safe.
segment.target: Internet Explorer 11 has many Group Policy entries that can be configured for keeping your environment managed and safe.

segment.source: This table includes all of our recommendations around security, performance, and compatibility with the previous versions of Internet Explorer, regardless of which Zone the website is in.
segment.target: This table includes all of our recommendations around security, performance, and compatibility with the previous versions of Internet Explorer, regardless of which Zone the website is in.

segment.source: Activity
segment.target: Activity

segment.source: Location
segment.target: Location

segment.source: Setting the policy object
segment.target: Setting the policy object

segment.source: Turn on Compatibility View for all intranet zones
segment.target: Turn on Compatibility View for all intranet zones

segment.source: Double-click Turn on IE Standards Mode for local intranet , and then click Disabled.
segment.target: Double-click Turn on IE Standards Mode for local intranet , and then click Disabled.

segment.source: Turn on Compatibility View for selected websites, using Group Policy
segment.target: Turn on Compatibility View for selected websites, using Group Policy

segment.source: Double-click Use Policy List of Windows Internet Explorer 7 sites , and then click Enabled.Users will be able to add or remove sites manually to their local Compatibility View list, but they won’t be able to remove the sites you specifically added.
segment.target: Double-click Use Policy List of Windows Internet Explorer 7 sites , and then click Enabled.Users will be able to add or remove sites manually to their local Compatibility View list, but they won’t be able to remove the sites you specifically added.

segment.source: Turn on Quirks mode for selected websites, using Group Policy
segment.target: Turn on Quirks mode for selected websites, using Group Policy

segment.source: Double-click Use Policy List of Quirks Mode sites, and then click Enabled.
segment.target: Double-click Use Policy List of Quirks Mode sites, and then click Enabled.

segment.source: Ensure your users are using the most up-to-date version of Microsoft’s compatibility list.
segment.target: Ensure your users are using the most up-to-date version of Microsoft’s compatibility list.

segment.source: Double-click Include updated Web site lists from Microsoft, and then click Enabled.
segment.target: Double-click Include updated Web site lists from Microsoft, and then click Enabled.

segment.source: Restrict users from making security zone configuration changes.
segment.target: Restrict users from making security zone configuration changes.

segment.source: Double-click Disable the Security Page, and then click Enabled.
segment.target: Double-click Disable the Security Page, and then click Enabled.

segment.source: Control which security zone settings are applied to specific websites.
segment.target: Control which security zone settings are applied to specific websites.

segment.source: Double-click Site to Zone Assignment List, click Enabled, and then enter your list of websites and their applicable security zones.
segment.target: Double-click Site to Zone Assignment List, click Enabled, and then enter your list of websites and their applicable security zones.

segment.source: Turn off Data Execution Prevention (DEP).
segment.target: Turn off Data Execution Prevention (DEP).

segment.source: Double-click Turn off Data Execution Prevention, and then click Enabled.
segment.target: Double-click Turn off Data Execution Prevention, and then click Enabled.
